page.title: 01The Ecchinswell Area
page.content: The small village of {Ecchinswell}and the surrounding farmland lie on the Hampshire/Berkshire border.Meadows, small copses,fields of grain divided by substantial hedges make up the overall picture of the area. Small streams run from the chalk downs in the south,and up to 1852 Ecchinswell was called{Itchingswell,}the name referring to these wells and streams. The large number of trees and bushes preclude the photographer from taking a general view from any standpoint.The main street contains no shops.{ {St.Lawrences Church}lies at the north end and {The Royal Oak}public house at the south,with{The Primary School}mid- way between.This is a village with very few amenities.The two main buildings of interest east of Ecchinswell are{The Star Inn}and { {Cheam School. }
